main event: Three crew members of a B aircraft sighted an unidentified luminous object over the North Pacific Ocean on April 20, 1958.
interesting points: The object was bright and appeared to maneuver before becoming smaller and disappearing., The crew members were familiar with celestial phenomena but were unable to identify the object., It was noted that the object might resemble the operation of a jet/rocket or starburner., The sighting lasted for 15 minutes and occurred at night., The report concluded that there was insufficient evidence to determine the identity of the object.
witness description: crew members familiar with celestial phenomena
